Text: Hear, O LORD, my righteous plea; listen to my cry. Give ear to my prayer—from lips free of deceit.
Context: David is presenting himself before God as someone who is being honest in his prayer, orienting the reader to the sincerity with which David approaches God.

Text: May my vindication come from Your presence; may Your eyes see what is right.
Context: David is asking for justice and for God to view his cause favorably, suggesting a trust that God will discern truth and act justly.

Text: You have tested my heart; You have visited me at night. You have tried me and found nothing; I have resolved that my mouth will not sin.
Context: David speaks of God examining him intimately and finding him innocent of wrongdoing, which is an important assertion in the context of his prayer for deliverance from his enemies.

Text: As for the deeds of men—by the word of Your lips I have avoided the ways of the violent.
Context: David declares his adherence to God’s commandments, avoiding violence, and attests to his own righteous behavior.

Text: My steps have held to Your paths; my feet have not slipped.
Context: David claims steady faithfulness in following God‘s ways, which reinforces his request for God’s attention and intervention.

Text: I call on You, for You will answer me, O God. Incline Your ear to me; hear my speech.
Context: Expressing belief in God‘s responsiveness, David confidently asks for God’s attention to his plea.

Text: Show the wonders of Your loving devotion, O Savior of those who seek refuge from their adversaries at Your right hand.
Context: David appeals to God‘s nature as a protector and requests to witness God’s miraculous love.

Text: Keep me as the apple of Your eye; hide me in the shadow of Your wings
Context: David asks for God‘s intimate protection and care, using metaphors that evoke a deep personal connection with God.

Text: Protect me from the wicked who despoil me, from my mortal enemies who surround me.
Context: David expresses a sense of danger from enemies who wish to do him harm, asking for God’s protection.

Text: Their hearts are callous; their mouths speak arrogantly.
Context: David characterizes his enemies as cruel and haughty, indicating the depth of their malice.

Text: They have tracked me down, they now surround me, with eyes alert to throw me to the ground.
Context: The imagery of being hunted emphasizes the immediate danger David feels from his adversaries.

Text: They are like a lion eager to tear, like a young lion lurking in ambush.
Context: The comparison to predatory animals conveys the violent intent and the treachery of David‘s enemies.

Text: Arise, O LORD, confront them! Bring them down; with Your sword rescue my soul from the wicked.
Context: David calls for God’s direct intervention against the threats to his life, envisioning God as a warrior capable of delivering him.

Text: By Your hand, O LORD, from men of the world whose portion is in this life—you fill the belly of those You cherish with food; they are satisfied with children, and they leave their abundance to their babies.
Context: David contrasts the temporal rewards of the wicked with the eternal portion he seeks from God, implying a disdain for their worldly pursuits and consequent satisfaction.

Text: As for me, in righteousness I shall behold Your face; when I awake, I shall be satisfied with Your likeness.
Context: In contrast with the previous verse, David looks forward to a future when he will see God Himself and find ultimate fulfillment in God‘s presence, rather than in earthly treasures.
